dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: What's your name?

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Myra.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Have you heard of fractals before?

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: No, absolutely not.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: So a fractal is something that we see every day, but it's a little bit hard to describe. It's it's a shape that if you look at it really far away, or you look at it really up close, it has kind of a similar appearance. And actually that word fractal sounds a little bit like fraction.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Right? So actually fractals are in some way fractions, but for shapes. Have you ever seen a movie called Moana?

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Yeah. Moana lives on this like beautiful island, right?

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: This island has lots of trees on it. Some artists had to make all those trees. How do you think they do that?

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: They tried to find something similar to that on the Google and they try to picture it in their heads saying, what would, what would it look like if they, it was animated?

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: So somehow they have to explain to the computer what a tree looks like so that the computer can draw the tree for them.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: And that's kind of what we're gonna try out today. In fact, we're gonna have you build a fractal. A tree is a really good example of a fractal because if you look at the whole tree and then you break off a big branch of the tree.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: It almost looks like that branch that you broke off is itself another tree. So our rule is that every branch splits into two smaller branches.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: So your tree is totally beautiful, but it took a long time to make, right. How would you feel if I said, now you have to make a thousand of those trees.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: I'd be like, oh my that's a lot of work.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's a ton of work. If you think about Moana's island, it has these tens and hundreds of thousands of trees on it. And that's why we need computers to help us out because computers are really good at taking these really simple rules, like put two branches on every other branch and doing it really, really fast.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: I want to know how to draw a fractal.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: On a computer if you wanna learn to draw fractals, then you might need to learn a little bit about programming. [Keenan] Programming. Yeah.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Programming.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Like coding, exactly. That's what actually a lot of the artists for the movies are working with code rather than with a paintbrush. So in your own words, how would you describe a fractal to somebody?

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Like coding.

dialogue.author: Explainer
dialogue.text: Definitely that is totally what fractals are all about.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: I would describe a fractal by saying that when you see a, a object, if you zoom in closely, you'll see that it's, it's broken down into pieces. So as you zoom in more closely, you'll keep seeing smaller and smaller pieces.

dialogue.author: Explainee
dialogue.text: Yes.
